result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Samuel Velasco Palos in court.  Attorney Francis R. Lettenberger in court for Samuel Velasco Palos.  Saul Arteaga, interpreter, in court.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant looking into OWI Court; requesting another status hearing.
Status conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

records.addlTxt:
3:05 PM (64-06) Defendant Samuel Velasco Palos with Spanish Interpreter Saul Artega, sworn by clerk in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin ADA Herrmann  in court.  Attorney Francis R. Lettenberger in court for Samuel Velasco Palos. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 

State is requesting 30 days. Waiting on blood results.

Arraignment scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Samuel Velasco Palos in court.  Attorney Francis R. Lettenberger in court for Samuel Velasco Palos. Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin. Reading of complaint waived. Rights given & hearing requested. Time period waived. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Samuel Velasco Palos in court. Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin. Right to attorney options form given; referred to State Public Defenders Office. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Bond remains. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Order to seal - Notice of arrest
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
